attributes.action: Have a serious look at tax levels for low earning members of the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I think Mr Brown should have a serious look at the tax levels for low earning members of the UK.
I for example earn £17500 per annum gross. This is for my main only job ( 45hours minimum) as a retail manager for a newsagent/small convience shop company.
This figure works out to £1416 gross per month of this National Insurance is £114 and tax is a huge £198. Total deductions £313 a month leaving me just over £1100 for the month. 
Of this £100 is council tax!! 
I am a young gay male who I feel is being penalised for not having children as I obviously dont get any family tax credit or working tax credit.
It seems that Mr Browns government does not look after people like myself that pose very little drains on government resources.
As you can tell from this many of my friends tell me i'd be better off on the dole or trying to claim one of the hundereds of benefits.
If you agree with me please sign this petition
